articles.author: Yannick, Customer Care Team Leader - Pro Team
articles.description:
Action required
  
Following our recent messages concerning the changes needed for your website domains, we would like to inform you that we have extended the support for the previous configuration until April 10 2023.
If you have not made the needeed changes yet, please consult our manual article here.
If you need assistance doing the changes, please contact our support team and we will be happy to assist you with the modifications. Please make sure to have access to your registrar (Gandi, OVH, Godaddy…) so we can assist you in performing this change.
Thanks,
articles.title: Reminder - Important information regarding your website domain!

articles.author: Yannick, Customer Care Team Leader - Pro Team
articles.description:
Action required
  
As we are doing some improvements on our infrastructure, we have some modifications that are necessary on the way some of your website domains are configured.
To ensure that you have the best configuration, we invite you to review the settings on your registrar to make sure that you have the correct configuration.
What is needed?
Your main domain should be under a **Cname **record with **www **and point to dns1.happystay.com. (the "dot" at the end may be required depending on your domain).
(example for your main domain: www.yourwebsite.com)
You can also add an addon domain without using www if you want your website to be reachable this way, (example: yourwebsite.com).
In order to do that, you can configure an A record (Aname) in your DNS zone pointing to one of the following IP addresses:
13.248.140.34


76.223.14.214


These are the new addresses that are replacing the previous address: (52.210.201.133)
Important note, If you are using 52.210.201.133, you need to change to one of the new IP address as we will not be able to keep supporting this one on March 29th 2023.
If you need assistance doing this change, please contact our support team and we will be happy to assist you with the modifications. Please make sure to have access to your registrar (Gandi, OVH, Godaddy…) so we can assist you in performing this change. 
The details are also available on our manual.
Thanks,
articles.title: Follow up - Important information regarding your website domain!

articles.author: Yannick, Customer Care Team Leader - Pro Team
articles.description:
Communications
  
We will be doing some improvements on our website infrastructure which may temporarily affect your websites.
The maintenance will take place on tuesday March 14, 2023 at 06:00am CET and will have a duration of 3 hours max.
What will be the impact?
· Websites may not be unreachable for up to 10 minutes at maintenance time.
· SSL may be unavailable from the beginning of the maintenance for up to 3 hours (website will still be reachable without https)
Do I need to do anything?
This maintenance will impact the DNS zone we are using to link your website to our infrastructure, therefore some changes will be required in the 2 weeks following this update if you are using your own domain name with A records.
We will send a second communication with the information and update our manual to help you with this transition.
Of course our support team will be there to assist you.
Thank you for your comprehension,
articles.title: Important information regarding your website domain!

articles.description:
Description: An issue in the Tailscale coordination server allowed tailnets created by GitHub organizations which were subsequently renamed to be associated with a new GitHub organization with the previous name.
What happened?
Tailscale mapped tailnets created by GitHub organizations to their organization name, rather than to their organization ID. This meant that if a GitHub organization was renamed, and the previous name taken over by a new GitHub organization, the existing tailnet would be tied to the new GitHub organization instead of the original one.
Who is affected?
Up to 1,305 tailnets created by GitHub organizations may have been affected, if those GitHub organizations were renamed between 2021-06-18 and 2023-03-30 and fully relinquished the old GitHub organization name. Additiona…
articles.title: TS-2023-004

articles.description:
Reference: CVE-2023-28436
Severity: Medium
CVSS vector string: CVSS:3.0/AV:A/AC:L/PR:H/UI:R/S:C/C:H/I:N/A:N
Description: A vulnerability identified in the implementation of Tailscale SSH in FreeBSD allowed commands to be run with a higher privilege group ID than that specified by Tailscale SSH access rules.
Affected platforms: FreeBSD
Patched Tailscale client versions: v1.38.2 or later
What happened?
A difference in the behavior of the FreeBSD setgroups system call from POSIX meant that the Tailscale client running on a FreeBSD-based operating system did not appropriately restrict groups on the host when using Tailscale SSH. When accessing a FreeBSD host over Tailscale SSH, the egid of the tailscaled process was used instead of that of the user specified in Tailscale SSH access rules.
Who is affected?
9 tailnets with 22 FreeBSD nodes running Tailscale SSH since Tailscale v1.34 (released on 2022-12-04) may have had Tailscale SSH sessions with a higher privilege group ID than that specified in Tailscale SSH access rules.
We have notified affected organizations where we have security contacts.
What is the impact?
Tailscale SSH commands may have been run with a higher privilege group ID than that specified in Tailscale SSH access rules if they met all of the following criteria:
The destination node was a FreeBSD device with Tailscale SSH enabled;
Tailscale SSH access rules permitted access for non-root users; and
A non-interactive SSH session was used.
What do I need to do?
If you are running Tailscale on FreeBSD, upgrade to v1.38.2 or later to remediate the issue. Admins of a tailnet can view FreeBSD nodes with unpatched versions in the admin console.
To update the local ports tree in advance of what’s available upstream, you can:
cd /usr/ports/security/tailscale
edit the Makefile to set PORTVERSION to 1.38.2
make makesum
make install
Tailscale SSH on other platforms is not affected.
Credits
We would like to thank Ryan Belgrave for reporting this issue.
articles.title: TS-2023-003

Scheduled - As announced on July 5, 2021 we are deprecating our XML API connection.
XML listings can no longer be activated: this means that new XML listings will remain unlisted even if you set 
true
. The same is valid for existing listing that are deactivated (i.e. you will not be able to reactivate a XML listing if it gets unlisted).
More information about this enforcement here: https://developer.airbnb.com/docs/enforcement
articles.title: XML Migration Enforcement

articles.description:
Incident began at 2023-03-24 08:10 and ended at 2023-03-24 11:38 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

Incident Report

Summary

On 24 March 2023, Google Workspace Support Chat experienced issues displaying some support language options for 3 hours, 28 minutes. As a result, some customers may have been unable to choose their preferred support language when starting a chat session.

Root Cause

When Google Workspace customers choose chat support, the Support UI displays a list of languages the customer may choose from before the chat session begins.

On 24 March 2023 at 01:10 US/Pacific, engineers rolled out an update for the Support UI that migrated the language select dropdown to a new select component. This update introduced an issue where the rendering of the select component would cut off some language options when the number of available languages exceeded the select component’s container boundaries.

Remediation and Prevention

Google engineers were alerted to the issue via an internal report on 24 March 2023 at 03:27 US/Pacific and immediately started an investigation. Engineers identified the Support UI change as the cause of the issue at 04:13 US/Pacific and started a rollback of the update at 04:16 US/Pacific. The rollback finished at 04:38 US/Pacific, resolving the issue.

Google is committed to preventing a repeat of this issue in the future and is completing the following actions:

  • Update automated testing for Support UI releases to better detect these types of potential UI issues.

Detailed Description of Impact

On 24 March 2023 from 01:10 to 04:38 US/Pacific, Google Workspace Support Chat experienced issues displaying some support language options.

Normally, all languages the customer is entitled to use should appear in the list of languages whether available or not. For the duration of this issue, Workspace support admins may have not seen their preferred language listed at all.

Affected products: Google Workspace Support
articles.title: RESOLVED: We're investigating reports of an issue with Google Workspace Support. We will provide more information shortly.

articles.description:
Issue summary: 

On April 3rd, 2023 from 11:00 AM PDT until 11:45 AM PDT, users on certain cellular service networks had issues receiving SMS texts for two-factor authentication (2FA). 


Upon investigation, this was traced to one unverified toll free number, which prevented 2FA codes from being approved for delivery. That number was removed from our 2FA pool, and services have resumed as usual. We are reviewing our process and alerting around outgoing phone number verification to ensure the issue doesn't happen again.
articles.title: Incident: Some users have trouble receiving 2FA code via SMS

articles.description:
Issue summary: 

From March 31st, 2023 at 7:18 PM PDT to April 1st, 2023 at 11:30 AM PDT, some customers may not have been able to sign in to Slack with the 'Continue with Google' feature. 


During a routine cleanup process, we made some changes to the project behind the 'Continue with Google' feature. This change inadvertently prevented the Slack mobile apps from confirming the validity of customer Google accounts during login. 


We reverted this change, restoring normal login behaviour for all affected customers, and we're working to ensure it does not happen again. We apologize for any disruption to your work.
articles.title: Incident: Some users are unable to sign-in using the Continue with Google feature on the Android and iOS app

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On March 28th, 2023 from 2:40 PM to 3:43 PM PDT, some customers may have experienced difficulties editing messages in Slack. 


We identified that this issue was caused by a recent code change. We reverted the code to resolve the issue for all impacted customers.
articles.title: Incident: Some users may be unable to edit messages

articles.description:
The issue with navigation of back/forward in history functionality is now resolved for all users.


Please reload Slack (press Command/Control + Shift + R) and let us know if you are still running into any issues.


Thank you very much for your patience while we worked on getting this fix out the door.
articles.title: Incident: Some users may experience issues with using the back/forward in history functionality

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On March 21, 2023 at 7:32 AM PDT to March 22, 2023 at 8:06 AM PDT, the "Time when workflow started" variable is missing from all steps of the Workflow Builder for new and existing workflows. If the variable was used to publish to a Google Sheet, the cell would be empty.


We discovered a bug that made date fields invisible without any errors displayed, though workflows were still running and had access to the value.


We have released a fix on March 22, 2023 at 8:06 AM PDT. Previously impacted workflows need to retrieve the timestamps from the workflow in the Workflow Builder. We appreciate your patience while we sorted this out.
articles.title: Incident: “Time when workflow started” variable is missing from Workflow Builder steps

articles.description: We appreciate your patience while we've continued to investigate this issue. Some customers may still be impacted by the SSL certificate changes, however we will closely monitor reports and provide further updates through customer support tickets with the impacted users. Please reach out to our team at feedback@slack.com for further assistance.
articles.title: Incident: Some users may experience issues accessing api.slack.com

articles.description:
Issue summary: 

On March 13th, 2023 from 2:00 PM to 5:00 PM PDT, some Enterprise Grid customers using the Slack for Intune mobile app may have experienced errors or latency when logging in to Slack.


We identified that this issue was caused by a conflict between Slack functionality and a Slack for Intune preference. We deployed a manual fix, resolving the issue for all impacted users.
articles.title: Incident: Enterprise users see slowness or error messages when signing in on mobile

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On March 9, 2023 from 8:28 PM to March 10, 2023 8:40 AM PST, some users that were signed into multiple workspaces experienced a redirect issue when signing into the Google Drive app from Slack. 


After the sign-in button was clicked, the user was redirected to a different Slack workspace they were signed into, causing a 400 Bad Request response.


We made a code change to ensure the user was redirected to the proper workspace, fixing the authentication error and resolving the issue.
articles.title: Incident: Some customers are seeing errors when attempting to connect Google Drive

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On March 9, 2023 from 9:07 AM to 10:06 AM PST, some users experienced trouble with various features in Slack, such as adding bookmarks to channels, using workflows, connecting to Slack, or sending Slack Connect invites.


We discovered the service degradation was prompted by a load test that ran at a higher rate than intended, causing database outages to occur. To remediate the issue, we scaled back the load test to the normal rate which resolved the problem for all impacted users.
articles.title: Incident: Service degradation in Slack

articles.description:
Issue summary: 

On March 7, 2023 from 9:15 AM to 6:31 PM PST, some users may have experienced slow search response times or failed searches.


We made a routine adjustment to our infrastructure that inadvertently increased load and decreased response rates for our search servers. New messages sent during this period were not indexed immediately and would not have been searchable.


We restarted the affected server nodes, returning search performance to normal and allowing the system to catch up on the backlogged indexing tasks. Once the system handled the backlog and we confirmed that indexing was complete, full search functionality was restored to all customers.


Thank you for your patience while we worked through this. We apologize for any disruption to your work.
articles.title: Incident: Slowness searching in Slack

articles.description:
Apr  3, 23:56 CEST
Update - Twitter has suspended our app. We are continuing to investigate.
Apr  3, 21:29 CEST
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.
articles.title: Twitter app is down

articles.title: Increased delay in scenarios executions for users on eu1.make.com since 10:00 CET
